title: Rainbow animated thicker glow border for the specific login button only

requirements.summary: Enhance only the targeted login button’s glow border to be thicker, brighter, rainbow-spectrum, and visibly animated while preserving layout/click behavior and respecting disabled + reduced-motion states.
acceptanceCriteria: The selected button displays a clearly thicker border effect than before (more than the current subtle outline).
The border/glow uses a rainbow gradient (multiple distinct hues across the spectrum), not just a blue/purple gradient.
The glow is visibly animated (e.g., continuous rotation/pulse) under normal motion settings.
The button’s dimensions and layout do not change (no content shift or resize due to the glow).
The button remains fully clickable and behaves exactly as before (same onClick, disabled behavior preserved).
When the button is disabled, the glow effect is subdued and does not animate.
When the user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, the animation is disabled while keeping a static rainbow glow.

file_operations.description: Mark only the specific Sign In <Button> (the one at the provided XPath) with a unique, dedicated selector (e.g., a data attribute and/or unique class) so the enhanced rainbow glow styling applies exclusively to that button and does not affect any other buttons; preserve existing props (onClick, disabled, size) and existing layout classes.

Replace/extend the current glow-border CSS to target only the dedicated selector from LoginPage and implement a thicker, brighter, animated rainbow-spectrum glow using pseudo-elements (no layout impact via absolute positioning and pointer-events:none). Ensure: (1) stronger thickness (larger inset/padding) and brighter glow (higher opacity/blur/shadow), (2) rainbow gradient across distinct hues, (3) visible animation under normal motion, (4) subdued + non-animated styling when disabled, and (5) prefers-reduced-motion disables animation while keeping a static rainbow glow.
